title: Choucroute with Smothered Cabbage and Späetzle
ingredients: 4 smoked ham hocks, about 4 ounces each
4 (2 to 3 ounces each) links of Boudan Blanc (White German Sausages)
4 (2 to 3 ounces each) links of Boudan Noir (German Sausages)
½ head fresh white cabbage, shredded
1 pound fresh späetzle, cooked until tender
instructions: In a large saucepan, over medium heat, combine the water, beer, the chopped onions, celery, and carrots, the garlic and bay leaves.  Season with salt and add the ham hocks.  Bring the mixture to a boil then reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 2 hours.
Add the sausages and continue cooking for 20 minutes longer.

In a large pan sauté, over medium heat, the bacon until it’s crispy, about 6 to 8 minutes.  Remove the bacon and set it aside.  Add the onions, season with black pepper, and sauté for 4 minutes.  Add the cabbage and continue sautéing until the cabbage is wilted; about 6 minutes then stir in the cream.  Bring the liquid to a boil then reduce the heat to medium-low and add the späetzle, season with salt and pepper.  Simmer for 4 to 6 minutes then remove from the heat.
Remove the ham hocks and sausage from the liquid.
To serve, remove the meat from the ham-hocks and place on a large serving plate.  Arrange the sausage on the platter and spoon the cabbage and späetzle on the plate.  Garnish with parsley.
